comments:
I am seeing quite a few such exceptions in my .log file. 
Environment:
Eclipse: 3.2.1 
Mylar: 1.0
Windows XP SP2
Sun Java SDK 1.6.0
Plugins (most important):
  - AJDT
  - oXygen
  - Subversive

Log:

*** Bug 168037 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This could be a duplicate of bug 167784.  But I need to know a bit more: does it happen on every startup?

Frankly speaking it is quite hard to say. I will reinstall 1.0 and watch it carefully. 

./alex
--
.w( the_mindstorm )p.

(In reply to comment #2)
> This could be a duplicate of bug 167784.  But I need to know a bit more: does
> it happen on every startup? 
> 

Yes, there is a great chance.

I'm almost certain of it too.  

Alex: I'm still curious, does this happen on every restart?

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 167784 ***

I'm seeing behaviour exactly as described in this bug under Mylar 2.0M1 on Eclipse 3.3M5 using Linux-GTK. This is on a 2.5MHz core duo laptop (a Lenovo T60), with memory to spare.  It happens on each start, though it's not the same classes that are not fully initialized.  So far I've seen this occur for the following classes:  org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.TaskListColorsAndFonts, org.eclipse.mylar.internal.context.ui.editors.ContextEditorFactory, org.eclipse.mylar.internal.context.ui.ContextUiImages, org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.ITaskHighlighter.

Here's an example of a stack trace reported:
